data.quote: The past which is so presumptuously brought forward as a precedent for the present was itself founded on some past that went before it.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: "Old times" never come back and I suppose it's just as well. What comes back is a new morning every day in the year  and that's better.
data.author: George E. Woodberry

data.quote: We have inherited new difficulties because we have inherited more privileges.
data.author: Dr. Abram Sacher

data.quote: People are always asking about the good old days. I say  why don't you say the good "now" days? Isn't "now" the only time you're living?
data.author: Robert M. Young

data.quote: Life in the twentieth century undeniably has ... such richness  joy and adventure as were unknown to our ancestors except in their dreams.
data.author: Arthur H. Campton

data.quote: Enjoy yourself. These are the "good old days" you're going to miss in the years ahead.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The past is our very being.
data.author: David Ben-Gurion

data.quote: To disdain today is to prove that yesterday has been misunderstood.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: The universe is made of stories  not of atoms.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: This is not a dress rehearsal. This is It.
data.author: Tom Cunningham

data.quote: Only when your consciousness is totally focused on the moment you are in can you receive whatever gift  esson  or delight that moment has to
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: Seize the day  and put the least possible trust in tomorrow.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Tomorrow's life is too late. Live today.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Half of today is better than all of tomorrow.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today  because if you enjoy it today  you can do it again  tomorrow.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Today is the first day of the rest of your life.
data.author: Abbie Hoffman

data.quote: The present moment is significant  not as the bridge between past and future  but by reason of its contents  which can fill our emptiness and become ours  if we are capable of receiving them
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: All of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: It's not that "today is the first day of the rest of my life " but that now is all there is of my life.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: We want to live in the present  and the only history that is worth a tinker's damn is the history we make today.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: Now is the only time we own  give  love  toil with a will. And place no faith in tomorrow  for the clock may then be still.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Enjoy yourself  drink  call the life you live today your own-but only that  the rest belongs to chance.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: You are younger today than you ever will be again. Make use of it for the sake of tomorrow.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If we are ever to enjoy life  now is the time  not tomorrow or next year. ... Today should always be our most wonderful day.
data.author: Thomas Dreier

data.quote: Live now  believe me  wait not till tomorrow  gather the roses of life today.
data.author: Pierre de Ronsard

data.quote: So often we rob tomorrow's memories by today's economies.
data.author: John Mason Brown

data.quote: You had better live your best and act your best and think your best today  for today is the sure preparation for tomorrow and all the other tomorrows that follow.
data.author: Harriet Martineau

data.quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone He can call today his own. He who  secure within can say  "Tomorrow  do thy worst  for I have lived today."
data.author: Henry Fielding

data.quote: Forget mistakes. Forget failures. Forget everything except what you're going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: Yesterday is ashes  tomorrow wood. Only today does the fire burn brightly.
data.author: Old Eskimo proverb

data.quote: One of these days is none of these days.
data.author: H. G. Bohn

data.quote: This is the day which the Lord has made. Let us rejoice and be glad in it.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He growled at morning  noon  and night  And trouble sought to borrow  Although today the sky was bright  He knew t'would storm tomorrow  A thought of joy he could not stand  And struggled to resist it  Though sunshine dappled all the land This sorry pessimist it.
data.author: Nixon Waterman

data.quote: To those leaning on the sustaining infinite  to-day is big with blessings.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: The here-and-now is no mere filling of time  but a filling of time with God.
data.author: John Foster

data.quote: In the present  every day is a miracle.
data.author: James Gould Cozzens

data.quote: Life is only this place  this time  and these people right here and now.
data.author: Vincent Collins

data.quote: I believe that only one person in a thousand knows the trick of really living in the present.
data.author: Storm Jameson

data.quote: There is one thing we can do  and the happiest people are those who do it to the limit of their ability. We can be completely present. We can be all here. We can ... give all our attention to the opportunity before us.
data.author: Mark Van Doren

data.quote: The more I give myself permission to live in the moment and enjoy it without feeling guilty or judgmental about any other time  the better I feel about the quality of my work.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: Act-act in the living Present!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Are not my days few? Cease then  and let me alone  that I may take comfort a little  Before I go to the place from which I shall not return.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Now or never was the time.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: And now  Lord  what wait I for?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The future belongs to those who live intensely in the present.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The present is elastic to embrace infinity.
data.author: Louis Anspacher

data.quote: The present is the living sum-total of the whole past.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: The present is an eternal now.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: The present is all the ready money Fate can give.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: The present is an edifice which God cannot rebuild.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The present is the blocks with which we build.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: The present is the symbol and vehicle of the future.
data.author: Joseph McSorely

data.quote: The present is all you have for your certain possession.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that  all knowledge is moonshine.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Having spent the better part of my life trying either to relive the past or experience the future before it arrives  I have come to believe that in between these two extremes is peace.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: This time  like all times  is a very good one if we but know what to do with it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: One realm we have never conquered: the pure present.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: He who lives in the present lives in eternity.
data.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

data.quote: I am in the present. I cannot know what tomorrow will bring forth. I can know only what the truth is for me today. That is what I am called upon to serve.
data.author: Igor Stravinsky

data.quote: The present offers itself to our touch for only an instant of time and then eludes the senses.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: A life uncommanded now is uncom-manded  a life unenjoyed now is unenjoyed  a life not lived wisely now is not lived wisely.
data.author: David Grayson

data.quote: The word "now" is like a bomb thrown through the window  and it ticks.
data.author: Arthur Miller

data.quote: Whether it's the best of times or the worst of times  it's the only time we've got.
data.author: Art Buchwald

data.quote: It is now  and in this world  that we must live.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Who cares about great marks left behind? We have one life.... Just one. Our life. We have nothing else.
data.author: Ugo Betti

data.quote: This-the immediate  everyday  and present experience-is IT  the entire and ultimate point for the existence of a universe.
data.author: Alan Watts

data.quote: Let us live today.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Work accomplished means little. It is in the past. What we all want is the glorious and living present.
data.author: Sherwood Anderson

data.quote: Yesterday is a cancelled check. Tomorrow is a promissory note. Today is cash in hand. Spend It!
data.author: John W Newbern

data.quote: Today Relative to Yesterday or Tomorrow The future is made of the same stuff as the present.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: Yesterday is but a dream  tomorrow is only a vision. But today  well lived  makes every yesterday a dream of happiness  and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well  therefore  to this day  for it is life  the very life of life.
data.author: The Sanskrit

data.quote: Be glad today. Tomorrow may bring tears. Be brave today. The darkest night will pass. And golden rays will usher in the dawn.
data.author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

data.quote: Do not look back on happiness  or dream of it in the future. You are only sure of today  do not let yourself be cheated out of it.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Existence is no more than the precarious attainment of relevance in an intensely mobile flux of past  present  and future.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow  for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
data.author: William Allen White

data.quote: The past  the present and the future are really one: they are today.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: The present contains all that there is. It is holy ground  for it is the past  and it is the future.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: There is no justification for present existence other than its expansion into an indefinitely open future.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: With the past  I have nothing to do  nor with the future. I live now.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present  which seldom happens to us.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: The past is a bucket of ashes  so live not in your yesterdays  nor just for tomorrow  but in the here and now.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Youth is the time of getting  middle age of improving  and old age of spending.
data.author: Anne Bradstreet

data.quote: It is not the weight of the future or the past that is pressing upon you  but ever that of the present alone. Even this burden  too  can be lessened if you confine it strictly to its own limits.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Reappraise the past  reevaluate where we've been  clarify where we are  and predict or anticipate where we are headed.
data.author: Toni Cade Bambara

data.quote: We can easily manage if we will only take  each day  the burden appointed to it. But the load will be too heavy for us if we carry yesterday's burden over again today  and then add the burden of the morrow before we are required to bear it.
data.author: John Newton

data.quote: Take in the ideas of the day  drain off those of yesterday. As to the morrow  time enough to consider it when it becomes today.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Tomorrow I will live  the fool does say  today itself's too late  the wise lived yesterday.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: The cares of today are seldom those of tomorrow.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Yesterday is a cancelled check  tomorrow is a promissory note  today is the only cash you have-so spend it wisely.
data.author: Kay Lyons

data.quote: Everyman's life lies within the present  for the past is spent and done with  and the future is uncertain.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The flesh endures the storms of the present alone  the mind those of the past and future as well.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: I try to learn from the past  but I plan for the future by focusing exclusively on the present. That's where the fun is.
data.author: Donald Trump

data.quote: No mind is much employed upon the present  recollection and anticipation fill up almost all our moments.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The only living life is in the past and future-the present is an interlude- strange interlude in which we call on past and future to bear witness that we are living.
data.author: Eugene O'Neill

data.quote: Past  and to come  seems best  things present  worst.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The past cannot be regained  although we can learn from it  the future is not yet ours even though we must plan for it. ... Time is now. We have only today.
data.author: Charles Hummell

data.quote: Look not mournfully into the past  it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present  it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: No longer forward nor behind I look in hope or fear  but grateful  take the good I find  the best of now and here.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: The present  like a note in music  is nothing but as it appertains to what is past and what is to come.
data.author: Walter Savage Landor

data.quote: We can see well into the past  we can guess shrewdly in to the future  but that which is rolled up and muffled in impenetrable folds is today.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The present time is seldom able to fill desire or imagination with immediate enjoyment  and we are forced to supply its deficiencies by recollection or anticipation.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Be satisfied  and pleased with what thou art  Act cheerfully and well thy allotted part  Enjoy the present hour  be thankful for the past  And neither fear  nor wish  the approaches of the last.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: It is difficult to live in the present  ridiculous to live in the future and impossible to live in the past.
data.author: Jim Bishop

data.quote: If you have one eye on yesterday  and one eye on tomorrow  you're going to be cockeyed today.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Yesterday has gone. Tomorrow may never come. There is only the miracle of this moment. Savor it. It is a gift.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Don't waste today regretting yesterday instead of making a memory for tomorrow.
data.author: Laura Palmer

data.quote: Light tomorrow with today.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: I just take one day. Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not come. We have only today to love Jesus.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Patterns of the past echo in the present and resound through the future.
data.author: Dhyani Ywahoo

data.quote: Who controls the past controls the future  who controls the present controls the past.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: If we spend our time with regrets over yesterday  and worries over what might happen tomorrow  we have no today in which to live.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Now is all we have. Everything that has ever happened to you  and anything that is ever going to happen to you  is just a thought.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: The present is the necessary product of all the past  the necessary cause of all the future.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: If we open a quarrel between the past and the present  we shall find we have lost the future.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Few of us ever live in the present  we are forever anticipating what is to come or remembering what has gone.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past  not to worry about the future  nor to anticipate troubles  but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: When we have a world of only now  with no shadows of yesterdays or clouds of tomorrow  then saying what we can do will work.
data.author: Goldie Ivener

data.quote: I can feel guilty about the past  apprehensive about the future  but only in the present can I act. The ability to be in the present moment is a major component of mental wellness.
data.author: Abraham Maslow

data.quote: I have realized that the past and the future are real illusions  that they exist only in the present  which is what there is and all that there is.
data.author: Alan Watts

data.quote: There is no present or future  only the past  happening over and over again  now.
data.author: Eugene O'Neill

data.quote: Today was once the future from which you expected so much in the past.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Today is yesterday's pupil.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Today is yesterday's effect and tomorrow's cause.
data.author: Phillip Gribble

data.quote: Through loyalty to the past  our mind refuses to realize that tomorrow's joy is possible only if today's makes way for it  that each wave owes the beauty of its line only to the withdrawal of the preceding one.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: The present is the now  the here  through which all future plunges to the past.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: I have everything I need to enjoy my here and now-unless I am letting my consciousness be dominated by demands and expectations based on the dead past or the imagined future.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: Today is the blocks with which we build.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: In order to be utterly happy  the only thing necessary is to refrain from comparing this moment with other moments in the past  which I often did not fully enjoy because I was comparing them with other moments of the future.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Seize from every moment its unique novelty  and do not prepare your joys.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: You don't need endless time and perfect conditions. Do it now. Do it today. Do it for twenty minutes and watch your heart start beating.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: Do not manage as if you had ten thousand years before you. Look you  death stands at your elbow  make the most of your minute  and be good for something while it is in your power.
data.author: Charles Palmer

data.quote: And if not now  when?
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: As we are always preparing to be happy  it is inevitable that we should never be so.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Why not seize the pleasure at once? How often is happiness destroyed by preparation  foolish preparation!
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: When shall we live if not now?
data.author: M. F. K. Fisher

data.quote: We cannot put off living until we are ready. The most salient characteristic of life is its coerciveness: it is always urgent  "here and now " without any possible postponement. Life is fired at us point-blank.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Very few men  properly speaking  live at present  but are providing to live another time.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Freedom from worries and surcease from strain are illusions that always inhabit the distance.
data.author: Edwin Way Teale

data.quote: Study as if you were to live forever. Live as if you were to die tomorrow.
data.author: Saint Isidore of Seville

data.quote: The best preparation for a better life next year is a full  complete  harmonious  joyous life this year.
data.author: Thomas Dreier

data.quote: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm  you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
data.author: Morris West

data.quote: Some people are making such thorough preparation for rainy days that they aren't enjoying today's sunshine.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: The greater part of our lives is spent in dreaming over the morrow  and when it comes  it  too  is consumed in the anticipation of a brighter morrow  and so the cheat is prolonged  even to the grave.
data.author: Mark Rutherford

data.quote: It is cheap generosity which promises the future in compensation for the present.
data.author: J. A. Spender

data.quote: Who knows if the gods above will add tomorrow's span to this day's sum?
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Defer not till tomorrow to be wise  tomorrow's sun to thee may never rise.
data.author: William Congreve

data.quote: My head is buried in the sands of tomorrow  while my tail feathers are singed by the hot sun of today.
data.author: John Barrymore

data.quote: Today  well lived  will prepare me for both the pleasure and the pain of tomorrow.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The future belongs to those who live intensely in the present.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Every moment that I am centered in the future  I suffer a temporary loss of this life.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: We know nothing of tomorrow  our business is to be good and happy today.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: We are always beginning to live  but are never living.
data.author: Manilius

data.quote: Live wastes itself while we are preparing to live.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I have always been waiting for something better-sometimes to see the best I had snatched from me.
data.author: Dorothy Reed Mendenhall

data.quote: Men spend their lives in anticipation  in determining to be vastly happy at some period when they have time. But the present time has one advantage over every other-it is our own.... We may lay in a stock of pleasures  as we would lay in a stock of wine  but if we defer the tasting of them too long  we shall find that both are soured by age.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: You do well to have visions of a better life than of every day  but it is the life of every day from which the elements of a better life must come.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: The most effective way to ensure the value of the future is to confront the present courageously and constructively.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: The habit of looking into the future and thinking that the whole meaning of the present lies in what it will bring forth is a pernicious one. There can be no value in the whole unless there is value in the parts.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: You don't save a pitcher for tomorrow. Tomorrow it may rain.
data.author: Leo Durocher

data.quote: Very strange is this quality of our human nature which decrees that unless we feel a future before us we do not live completely in the present.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: Just do your best today and tomorrow will come ... tomorrow's going to be a busy day  a happy day.
data.author: Helen Boehm

data.quote: Do today's duty  fight today's temptation  do not weaken and distract yourself by looking forward to things you cannot see  and could not understand if you saw them.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Live for today. Multitudes of people have failed to live for today. ... What they have had within their grasp today they have missed entirely  because only the future has intrigued them.
data.author: William Allen White

data.quote: Present opportunities are neglected  and attainable good is slighted  by minds busied in extensive ranges and intent upon future advantages.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Light tomorrow with today.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: A preoccupation with the future not only prevents us from seeing the present as it is  but often prompts us to rearrange the past.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: The man least dependent upon the morrow goes to meet the morrow most cheerfully.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: Today's egg is better than tomorrow's hen.
data.author: Turkish proverb

data.quote: T'were too absurd to slight for the hereafter  the day's delight!
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: The best part of our lives we pass in counting on what is to come.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: It seems to be the fate of man to seek all his consolations in futurity.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The prospect of being pleased tomorrow will never console me for the boredom of today.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life  not the top.
data.author: Robert M. Pirsig

data.quote: We steal if we touch tomorrow. It is God's.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: The past and present are only our means  the future is always our end. Thus we never really live  but only hope to live.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: The president is the representative of the whole nation and he's the only lobbyist that all the one hundred and sixty million people in this country have.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: Trying to make the presidency work these days is like trying to sew buttons on a custard pie.
data.author: James David Barber

data.quote: Th' prisidincy is th' highest office in th' gift iv th people. Th' vice-prisidincy is th' next highest an' the lowest. It isn't a crime exactly. Ye can't be sint to jail f r it  but it's a kind iv a disgrace.
data.author: Finley Peter Dunne

data.quote: Seriously  I do not think I am fit for the presidency.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: An eminent American is reported to have said to friends who wished to put him forward  'Gentlemen  let there be no mistake. I should make a good president  but a very bad candidate.'
data.author: James Bryce

data.quote: Well  I wouldn't say that I was in the 'great' class  but I had a great time while I was trying to be great.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: The presidency does not yield to definition. Like the glory of a morning sunrise  it can be experienced - it can not be told.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: When the president does it  that means it is not illegal.
data.author: Richard Nixon

data.quote: A president's hardest task is not to do what's right  but to know what's right.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: Had I been chosen president again  I am certain I could not have lived another year.
data.author: John Adams

data.quote: The four most miserable years of my life . . .
data.author: John Adams

data.quote: If you are as happy  my dear sir  on entering this house as I am in leaving it and returning home  you are the happiest man in the country.
data.author: James Buchanan

data.quote: I feel like the man who was tarred and feathered and ridden out of town on a rail. To the man who asked how he liked it he said: 'If it wasn't for the honour of the thing  I'd rather walk.'
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The office of president requires the constitution of an athlete  the patience of a mother  the endurance of an early Christian.
data.author: Harold Wilson

data.quote: Within the first few months I discovered that being a president is like riding a tiger. A man has to keep riding or be swallowed.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: Harricum! Harricum! Give 'em hell  Harricum!
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: In America  any boy may become president  and I suppose it's just one of the risks he takes.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: I have no expectation of making a hit every time I come to bat.
data.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

data.quote: I think the American public wants a solemn ass as a president  and I think I'll go along with them.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: I desire to so conduct the affairs of this administration that if  at the end ... I have lost every friend on earth  I shall have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside me.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The final greatness of the presidency lies in the truth that it is not just an office of incredible power but a breeding ground of indestructible myth.
data.author: Clinton Rossiter

data.quote: I beg leave to assure the Congress that no pecuniary consideration could have tempted me to accept this arduous employment at the expense of my domestic ease and happiness. I do not wish to make any profit from it.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: Don't let it be forgot  That once there was a spot -For one brief shining moment That was known as Camelot.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: The buck stops here.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: The ocean and I have many pebbles To find and wash off and roll into shape.
data.author: William Stafford

data.quote: The sea possesses a power over one's moods that has the effect of a will. The sea can hypnotize. Nature in general can do so.
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: Roll on  thou deep and dark blue ocean - roll! Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain  Man marks the earth with ruin - his control Stops with the shore.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: The sea - the truth must be confessed - has no generosity. No display of manly qualities - courage  hardihood  endurance  faithfulness - has ever been known to touch its irresponsible consciousness of power.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: Being in a ship is being in a jail  with the chance of being drowned.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The sea hath no king but God alone.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: I liked to sail alone. The sea was the same as a girl to me - I did not want anyone else along.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: I do not love the sea. The look of it is disquieting. There is something in the very sound of it that stirs the premonition felt while we listen to noble music  we become inexplicably troubled.
data.author: H. M. Tomlinson

data.quote: The only cure for seasickness is to sit on the shady side of an old church in the country.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have observed  on board a steamer  how men and women easily give way to their instinct for flirtation  because water has the power of washing away our sense of responsibility  and those who on land resemble the oak in their firmness behave like floating seaweed when on the sea.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: A poor woman from Manchester  on being taken to the seaside  is said to have expressed her delight on seeing for the first time something of which there was enough for everybody.
data.author: John Lubbock

data.quote: There's never an end for the sea.
data.author: Samuel Beckett

data.quote: April is the cruellest month  breeding Lilacs out of the dead land  mixing memory and desire  stirring dull roots with Spring rain.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Autumn wins you best by this: its mute Appeal to sympathy for its decay.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Honest Winter  snow-clad  and with the frosted beard  I can welcome not uncordially  But that long deferment of the calendar's promise  that weeping gloom of March and April  that bitter blast outraging the honour of May how often has it robbed me of heart and hope?
data.author: George Gissing

data.quote: No one thinks of Winter when the grass is green.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: No Winter lasts forever  no Spring skips its turn. April is a promise that May is bound to keep  and we know it.
data.author: Hal Borland

data.quote: The nicest thing about the promise of spring is that sooner or later she'll have to keep it.
data.author: Mark Beltaire

data.quote: Now is the winter of our discontent Made glorious summer by this sun of York.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Every April  God rewrites the Book of Genesis.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The changing year's progressive plan Proclaims mortality to man.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Summer is the mother of the poor.
data.author: Italian proverb

data.quote: Take a winter as you find him and he turns out to be a thoroughly honest fellow with no nonsense in him: and tolerating none in you  which is a great comfort in the long run.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Summer ends  and Autumn comes  and he who would have it otherwise would have high tide always and a full moon every night.
data.author: Hal Borland

data.quote: June's too soon  July's too late - for summer.
data.author: Siberian saying

data.quote: April  Comes like an idiot  babbling  and strewing flowers.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: Autumn arrives in the early morning  but spring at the close of a winter's day.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: Autumn is the bite of a harvest apple.
data.author: Christina Petrowsky

data.quote: May is a pious fraud of the almanac A ghastly parody of real Spring Shaped out of snow and breathed with eastern wind.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The first day of spring was once the time for taking the young virgins into the fields  there in dalliance to set an example in fertility for Nature to follow. Now we just set the clock an hour ahead and change the oil in the crankcase.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: There is honor among thieves.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Set a thief to catch a thief.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: A plague upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: When thieves fall out  honest men come by their own.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Stolen waters are sweet  and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: A library is thought in cold storage.
data.author: Viscount Herbert Samuel

data.quote: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is a visible labour and there is an invisible labour.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: An Englishman thinks seated  a Frenchman  standing  an American  pacing  an Irishman  afterward.
data.author: Austin O'Malley

data.quote: Analogies  it is true  decide nothing  but they can make one feel more at home.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: Data data everywhere but not a thought to think.
data.author: Theodore Roszak

data.quote: One must live the way one thinks or end up thinking the way one has lived.
data.author: Paul Bourget

data.quote: One thought fills immensity.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Sometimes people mistake the way I talk for what I am thinking.
data.author: Idi Amin

data.quote: Thought is the labour of the intellect  reverie is its pleasure.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Three minutes' thought would suffice to find this out  . but thought is irksome and three minutes is a long time.
data.author: A. E. Housman

data.quote: When thought becomes excessively painful  action is the finest remedy.
data.author: Salman Rushdie

data.quote: Worrying is the most natural and spontaneous of all human functions. It is time to acknowledge this  perhaps even to learn to do it better.
data.author: Lewis Thomas

data.quote: All thought is a feat of association  having what's in front of you bring up something in your mind that you almost didn't know you knew.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: We only think when we are confronted with a problem.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: The extra calories needed for one hour of intense mental effort would be completely met by eating one oyster cracker or one half of a salted peanut.
data.author: Francis C. Benedict

data.quote: Every man who says frankly and fully what he thinks is doing a public service.
data.author: Leslie Stephen

data.quote: Thought is the strongest thing we have. Work done by true and profound thought - that is a real force.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: When a man knows he is to be hanged in a fortnight  it concentrates his mind wonderfully.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: We find it hard to believe that other people's thoughts are as silly as our own  but they probably are.
data.author: James Harvey Robinson

data.quote: Thinking is like loving and dying - each of us must do it for himself.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: A man of action forced into a state of thought is unhappy until he can get out of it.
data.author: John Galsworthy

data.quote: It is human nature to think wisely and to act in an absurd fashion.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Men use thought only to justify their wrongdoings  and speech only to conceal their thoughts.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The real offence  as she ultimately perceived  was her having a mind of her own at all. Her mind was to be his - attached to his own like a small garden plot to a deer park.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: To be uncertain is to be uncomfortable  but to be certain is to be ridiculous.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Think wrongly  if you please  but in all cases think for yourself.
data.author: Doris Lessing

data.quote: The thoughts that come often unsought  and  as it were  drop into the mind  are commonly the most valuable of any we have.
data.author: John Locke

data.quote: We shall succeed only so far as we continue that most distasteful of all activity  the intolerable labour of thought.
data.author: Learned Hand

data.quote: Profundity of thought belongs to youth  clarity of thought to old age.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Every real thought on every real subject knocks the wind out of somebody or other.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: What was once thought can never be unthought.
data.author: Friedrich Dilrrenmatt

data.quote: Many a time I have wanted to stop talking and find out what I really believed.
data.author: Walter Lippmann

data.quote: Man is a slow  sloppy and brilliant thinker  the machine is fast  accurate and stupid.
data.author: William M. Kelly

data.quote: Folks that blurt out just what they think wouldn't be so bad if they thought.
data.author: Kin Hubbard

data.quote: Facts in books  statistics in encyclopedias  the ability to use them in men's heads.
data.author: Fogg Brackell

data.quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts  wisdom lies in their simplification.
data.author: Martin H. Fisher

data.quote: The fundamental fact about the Greek was that he had to use his mind. The ancient priests had said 'Thus far and no farther. We set the limits of thought.' The Greek said  'All things are to be examined and called into question. There are no limits set on thought.'
data.author: Edith Hamilton

data.quote: Thought is born of failure.
data.author: Lancelot Law Whyte

data.quote: Speaking without thinking is shooting without taking aim.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: What you think is an illusion created by your glands  your emotions and  in the last analysis  by the content of your stomach. That gray matter you're so proud of is like a mirror in an amusement park which transmits to you nothing but distorted signals from reality forever beyond your grasp.
data.author: Ayn Rand

data.quote: Many highly intelligent people are poor thinkers. Many people of average intelligence are skilled thinkers. The power of a car is separate from the way the car is driven.
data.author: Edward de Bono

data.quote: Belief is harder to shake than knowledge.
data.author: Adolf Hitler

data.quote: The bliss e'en of a moment still is bliss.
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: Every second is of infinite value.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: The bliss e'en of a moment still is bliss.
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: Let me tell thee  time is a very precious gift of God  so precious that it's only given to us moment by moment.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: There are half hours that dilate to the importance of centuries.
data.author: Mary Catherwood

data.quote: This-this was what made life: a moment of quiet  the water falling in the fountain  the girl's voice ... a moment of captured beauty. He who is truly wise will never permit such moments to escape.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: We do not remember days  we remember moments.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
data.author: Corita Kent

data.quote: The span of life is waning fast  Beware  unthinking youth  beware! Thy soul's eternity depends Upon the record moments bear!
data.author: Eliza Cook

data.quote: Florence Farr once said to me  "If we could say to ourselves  with sincerity  'this passing moment is as good as any I shall ever know ' we could die upon the instant and be united with God."
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: Sometimes I would almost rather have people take away years of my life than take away a moment.
data.author: Pearl Bailey

data.quote: Life is not lost by dying  life is lost minute by minute  day by day  in all the thousand small  uncaring ways.
data.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

data.quote: I have the happiness of the passing moment  and what more can mortal ask?
data.author: George R. Gissing

data.quote: The sole life which a man can lose is that which he is living at the moment.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: I always say to myself  what is the most important thing we can think about at this extraordinary moment.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Fill the unforgiving minute with sixty seconds worth of distance run.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: The present moment is creative  creating with an unheard-of intensity.
data.author: Le Corbusier

data.quote: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle  which is exactly what it is: a miracle and unrepeatable.
data.author: Storm Jameson

data.quote: Who makes quick use of the moment is a genius of prudence.
data.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

data.quote: I live now and only now  and I will do what I want to do this moment and not what I decided was best for me yesterday.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: But what minutes! Count them by sensation  and not by calendars  and each moment is a day.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: It may be life is only worthwhile at moments. Perhaps that is all we ought to expect.
data.author: Sherwood Anderson

data.quote: To finish the moment  to find the journey's end in every step of the road  to live the greatest number of good hours  is wisdom.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Our latest moment is always our supreme moment. Five minutes delay in dinner now is more important than a great sorrow ten years gone.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: God speaks to all individuals through what happens to them moment by moment.
data.author: J. P. DeCaussade

data.quote: Be always resolute with the present hour. Every moment is of infinite value.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: A player's effectiveness is directly related to his ability to be right there  doing that thing  in the moment. ... He can't be worrying about the past or the future or the crowd or some other extraneous event. He must be able to respond in the here and now.
data.author: John Brodie

data.quote: We inhabit ourselves without valuing ourselves  unable to see that here  now  this very moment is sacred  but once it's gone-its value is incontestable.
data.author: Joyce Carol Oates

data.quote: Life is all memory except for the one present moment that goes by so quick you can hardly catch it going.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: The trouble is not that we are never happy-it is that happiness is so episodical.
data.author: Ruth Benedict

data.quote: Non-cooks think it's silly to invest two hours' work in two minutes' enjoyment  but if cooking is evanescent  so is the ballet.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: We have only this moment  sparkling like a star in our hand ... and melting like a snowflake. Let us use it before it is too late.
data.author: Marie Beynon Ray

data.quote: It is privilege of living to be ... acutely  agonizingly conscious of the moment that is always present and always passing.
data.author: Marya Mannes

data.quote: The passing moment is all we can be sure of  it is only common sense to extract its utmost value from it.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: He is blessed over all mortals who loses no moment of the passing life.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: We must not wish anything other than what happens from moment to moment  all the while  however  exercising ourselves in goodness.
data.author: Saint Catherine of Genoa

data.quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
data.author: Adrienne Rich

data.quote: If it weren't for the last minute  nothing would get done.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Once to every man and nation comes the moment to decide. ... And the choice goes by forever t'wixt that darkness and that light.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I have always felt that the moment when first you wake up in the morning is the most wonderful of the twenty-four hours. No matter how weary or dreary you may feel  you possess the certainty that... absolutely anything may happen. And the fact that it practically always doesn't  matters not one jot. The possibility is always there.
data.author: Monica Baldwin

data.quote: Every age can be enchanting  provided you live within it.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: To live exhilaratingly in and for the moment is deadly serious work  fun of the most exhausting sort.
data.author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

data.quote: Love the moment and the energy of the moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
data.author: Corita Kent

data.quote: Life isn't a matter of milestones  but of moments.
data.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

data.quote: The power of Thought  - the magic of the Mind!
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: My thoughts ran a wool-gathering.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Any man may make a mistake  none but a fool will stick to it. Second thoughts are best as the proverb says.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Learning without thought is labor lost.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: I think  therefore I am.
data.author: Rene Descartes

data.quote: Thoughts that breathe and words that burn.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: Great thoughts reduced to practice become great acts.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The mind grows by what it feeds on.
data.author: J. G. Holland

data.quote: A penny for your thought.
data.author: John Lyly

data.quote: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: As he thinketh in his heart  so is he.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: There is nothing either good or bad  but thinking makes it so.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Yond Cassius has a lean and hungry look  He thinks too much: such men are dangerous.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
data.author: Sir Philip Sidney

data.quote: Great thoughts come from the heart.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: It's no use filling your pocket with money if you have got a hole in the corner.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: A penny saved is a penny earned.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: It is better to have a hen tomorrow than an egg today.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: He that will not stoop for a pin will never be worth a pound.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: A man who both spends and saves money is the happiest man  because he has both enjoyments.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: That great artillery of God Almighty.
data.author: William Temple

data.quote: 3 o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: All movements go too far.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Nothing is improbable until it moves into the past tense.
data.author: George Ade

data.quote: Nothing really belongs to us but time  which even he has who has nothing else.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Respect the past in the full measure of its desserts  but do not make the mistake of confusing it with the present nor seek in it the ideals of the future.
data.author: Josi Incenieros

data.quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments  And has time enough.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: The passing minute is every man's equal possession but what has once gone by is not ours.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: This only is denied even to God: the power to undo the past.
data.author: Agathon

data.quote: Time is a Test of Trouble - But not a Remedy - If such it proved  it proves too There was no Melody.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Time is the rider that breaks youth.
data.author: George Herbert

data.quote: To excel the past we must not allow ourselves to lose contact with it  on the contrary  we must feel it under our feet because we raised ourselves upon it.
data.author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Time is a great legalizer  even in the fields of morals.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Time goes  you say? Ah no! Alas  Time stays  we go.
data.author: Henry Austin Dobson

data.quote: Let time that makes you homely  make you sage.
data.author: Thomas Parnell

data.quote: I don't ask for your pity  but just your understanding - no  not even that -no. Just for your recognition of me in you  and the enemy  time  in us all.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: All things flow  nothing abides.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: When you sit with a nice girl for two hours  you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute  you think it's two hours. That's relativity.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: There was a young lady named Bright Who could travel much faster than light She started one day In the relative way And came back on the previous night.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Longevity conquers scandal every time.
data.author: Shelby Foote

data.quote: What may be done at any time will be done at no time.
data.author: Scottish proverb

data.quote: One of these days is none of these days.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Punctuality is the thief of time.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Enjoy the present hour  Be thankful for the past  And neither fear nor wish Th' approaches of the last.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: Horus non numero nisi serenas (I count only the sunny hours).
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The only true time which a man can properly call his own  is that which he has all to himself  the rest  though in some sense he may be said to live it  is other people's time  not his.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: I want to go ahead of Father Time with a scythe of my own.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: Time is a great teacher  but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
data.author: Hector Berlioz

data.quote: One third of the people of the world are asleep at any given moment. The other two thirds are awake and probably stirring up trouble somewhere.
data.author: Dean Rusk

data.quote: Time and I against any two.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Time discovered truth.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Time gives good advice.
data.author: Maltese proverb

data.quote: What a day may bring  a day may take away.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Time is a kindly god.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Time goes by: reputation increases  ability declines.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Time cools  time clarifies  no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: Every minute starts an hour.
data.author: Paul Gondola

data.quote: Time wounds all heels.
data.author: Jane Ace

data.quote: The apparent serenity of the past is an oil spread by time.
data.author: Lloyd Frankenberg

data.quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events  and strong is its current  no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place  and this too will be swept away.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It takes time to save time.
data.author: Joe Taylor

data.quote: The mind of man works with strangeness upon the body of time. An hour  once it lodges in the queer element of the human spirit  may be stretched to fifty or a hundred times its clock length  on the other hand  an hour may be accurately represented by the timepiece of the mind by one second.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: When you have a great and difficult task  something perhaps almost impossible  if you only work a little at a time  every day a little  suddenly the work will finish itself.
data.author: Isak Dinesen

data.quote: Champions know there are no shortcuts to the top. They climb the mountain one step at a time. They have no use for helicopters!
data.author: Judi Adler

data.quote: The world doesn't come to the clever folks  it comes to the stubborn  obstinate  one-idea-at-a-time people.
data.author: Mary Roberts Rinehart

data.quote: One of the greatest evils of the day among those outside of prison is their sense of futility. Young people say  What is the sense of our small effort? They cannot see that we must lay one brick at a time  take one step at a time  we can be responsible only for the one action of the present moment.
data.author: Dorothy Day

data.quote: One only gets to the top rung of the ladder by steadily climbing up one at a time  and suddenly all sorts of powers  all sorts of abilities which you thought never belonged to you- suddenly become within your own possibility and you think  "Well  I'll have a go  too."
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: Let no one be deluded that a knowledge of the path can substitute for putting one foot in front of the other.
data.author: Mary Caroline Richards

data.quote: Look at a stone cutter hammering away at his rock  perhaps a hundred times without as much as a crack showing in it. Yet at the hundred-and-first blow it will split in two  and I know it was not the last blow that did it  but all that had gone before.
data.author: Jacob A. Riis

data.quote: Home wasn't built in a day.
data.author: Jane Ace

data.quote: Happiness is a tide: it carries you only a little way at a time  but you have covered a vast space before you know that you are moving at all.
data.author: Mary Adams

data.quote: Not to go back is somewhat to advance. And men must walk  at least  before they dance.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Great things are not done by impulse  but by a series of small things brought together.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Well-being is attained little by little  and is no little thing itself.
data.author: Zeno

data.quote: Bigness comes from doing many small things well. ... Individually  they are not very dramatic transactions. Together  though  they add up.
data.author: Edward S. Finkelstein

data.quote: If you only keep adding little by little  it will soon become a big heap.
data.author: Hesiod

data.quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance  one cannot fly into flying.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: All that I have accomplished ... has been by that plodding  patient  persevering process of accretion which builds the ant heap particle by particle  thought by thought  fact by fact.
data.author: Elihu Burritt

data.quote: If we take care of the moments  the years will take care of themselves.
data.author: Maria Edgeworth

data.quote: Many things which cannot be overcome when they are together  yield themselves up when taken little by little.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: True worth is doing each day some little good  not dreaming of great things to do by and by.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Little by little does the trick.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: It is by attempting to reach the top at a single leap that so much misery is caused in the world.
data.author: William Cobbett

data.quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
data.author: Bernadette Devlin

data.quote: I think and think for months  for years. Ninety-nine times the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Many strokes overthrow the tallest oaks.
data.author: John Lyly

data.quote: Much rain wears the marble.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: One thing at a time  all things in succession. That which grows slowly endures.
data.author: J. G. Hubbard

data.quote: A successful individual typically sets his next goal somewhat  but not too much  above his last achievement.
data.author: Kurt Lewin

data.quote: One sits down first  one thinks afterwards.
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: We can do no great things-only small things with great love.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Many strokes  though with a little axe  hew down and fell the hardest-timber'd oak.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Progress is the sum of small victories won by individual human beings.
data.author: Bruce Catton

data.quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: A soul occupied with great ideas performs small duties.
data.author: Harriet Martineau

data.quote: The waters wear the stones.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: One step and then another  and the longest walk is ended. One stitch and then another  and the longest rent is mended. One brick upon another  and the tallest wall is made. One flake and then another  and the deepest snow is laid.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You don't just luck into things. ... You build step by step  whether it's friendships or opportunities.
data.author: Barbara Bush

data.quote: The way a chihuahua goes about eating a dead elephant is to take a bite and be very present with that bite. In spiritual growth  the definitive act is to take one step and let tomorrow's step take care of itself!
data.author: William H. Houff

data.quote: Victory is won not in miles  but in inches. Win a little now  hold your ground  and later win a little more.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: It is astonishing how short a time it takes for very wonderful things to happen.
data.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

data.quote: Inches make a champion.
data.author: Vince Lombardi

data.quote: Yard by yard  it's very hard. But inch by inch  it's a cinch.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If we take care of the inches  we will not have to worry about the miles.
data.author: Hartley Coleridge

data.quote: When Ty Cobb got on first base he had an apparently nervous habit of kicking the bag. ... By kicking the bag hard enough Cobb could move it a full two inches closer to second base. He figured that this improved his chances for a steal  or for reaching second base safely on a hit.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: Yard by yard  it's very hard. But inch by inch  it's a cinch.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: A harbor  even if it is a little harbor  is a good thing.... It takes something from the world  and has something to give in return.
data.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

data.quote: One can get just as much exultation in losing oneself in a little thing as in a big thing. It is nice to think how one can be recklessly lost in a daisy.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: Life is made up of little things. It is very rarely that an occasion is offered for doing a great deal at once. True greatness consists in being great in little things.
data.author: Charles Simmons

data.quote: Life is a great bundle of little things.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Nothing can be done except little by little.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Practice yourself in little things  and thence proceed to greater.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Those people work more wisely who seek to achieve good in their own small corner of the world ... than those who are forever thinking that life is in vain  unless one can ... do big things.
data.author: Herbert Butterfield

data.quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: You've got to think about "big things" while you're doing small things  so that all the small things go in the right direction.
data.author: Alvin Toffler

data.quote: Little strokes fell great oaks.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Take your needle  my child  and work at your pattern  it will come out a rose by and by. Life is like that  one stitch at a time taken patiently  and the pattern will come out all right  like embroidery.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Why not learn to enjoy the little things-there are so many of them.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Human felicity is produced not so much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen as by little advantages that occur every day.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Trifles make up the happiness or the misery of mortal life.
data.author: Alexander Smith

data.quote: Even a small star shines in the darkness.
data.author: Finnish proverb

data.quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: If you don't enjoy getting up and working and finishing your work and sitting down to a meal with family or friends  then the chances are you're not going to be happy. If someone bases his happiness or unhappiness on major events like a great new job  huge amounts of money  a flawlessly happy marriage or a trip to Paris  that person isn't going to be happy much of the time. If  on the other hand  happiness depends on a good breakfast  flowers in the yard  a drink or a nap  then we are more likely to live with quite a bit of happiness.
data.author: Andy Rooney

data.quote: The big things that come our way are ... the fruit of seeds planted in the daily routine of our work.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: The little things are infinitely the most important.
data.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

data.quote: Enjoy the little things  for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
data.author: Robert Brault

data.quote: It is in trifles  and when he is off his guard  that a man best shows his character.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Life is denied by lack of attention  whether it be to cleaning windows or trying to write a masterpiece.
data.author: Nadia Boulanger

data.quote: It was only a sunny smile  But it scattered the night And little it cost in the giving  Like morning light  And made the day worth living.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Sometimes the littlest things in life are the hardest to take. You can sit on a mountain more comfortably than on a tack.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect  and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
data.author: Swami Sivananda

data.quote: The smallest effort is not lost  Each wavelet on the ocean tost Aids in the ebb-tide or the flow  Each rain-drop makes some floweret blow  Each struggle lessens human woe.
data.author: Charles Mackay

data.quote: In life's small things be resolute and great To keep thy muscle trained  Know'st thou when Fate Thy measure takes  or when she'll say to thee  "I find thee worthy  do this deed for me?"
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much  and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: We think in generalities  but we live in detail.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something that I can do.
data.author: Edward Everett Hale

data.quote: I am convinced that there are times in everybody's experience when there is so much to be done  that the only way to do it is to sit down and do nothing.
data.author: Fanny Fern

data.quote: We cannot do everything at once  but we can do something at once.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Nobody makes a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could only do a little.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: We must not... ignore the small daily differences we can make which  over time  add up to big differences that we often cannot foresee.
data.author: Marian Wright Edelman

data.quote: A terrace nine stories high begins with a pile of earth.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: Not all things are blest  but the seeds of all things are blest.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: God requires a faithful fulfillment of the merest trifle given us to do  rather than the most ardent aspiration to things to which we are not called.
data.author: Saint Francis de Sales

data.quote: Large streams from little mountains flow  tall oaks from little acorns grow.
data.author: David Everett

data.quote: Instead of thinking about where you are  think about where you want to be. It takes twenty years of hard work to become an overnight success.
data.author: Diana Rankin

data.quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: The distance doesn't matter  only the first step is difficult.
data.author: Madame Marquise du Deffand

data.quote: Cultural transformation announces itself in sputtering fits and starts  sparked here and there by minor incidents  warmed by new ideas that may smolder for decades. In many different places  at different times  the kindling is laid for the real conflagration-the one that will consume the old landmarks and alter the landscape forever.
data.author: Marilyn Ferguson

data.quote: The greatest masterpieces were once only pigments on a palette.
data.author: Henry S. Haskins

data.quote: It is not the straining for great things that is most effective  it is the doing the little things  the common duties  a little better and better.
data.author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

data.quote: It's a simple formula: do your best and somebody might like it.
data.author: Dorothy Baker

data.quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Though thy beginning was small  yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Almost everything comes from almost nothing.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: From a little spark may burst a mighty flame.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: Start by doing what's necessary  then what's possible  and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
data.author: Saint Francis of Assisi

data.quote: If you wish to reach the highest  begin at the lowest.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: Great issues develop from small beginnings.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: Events of great consequence often spring from trifling circumstances.
data.author: Livy

data.quote: No matter how big and tough a problem may be  get rid of confusion by taking one little step toward solution. Do something.
data.author: George F. Nordenholt

data.quote: Most of the critical things in life  which become the starting points of human destiny  are little things.
data.author: R. Smith

data.quote: Sow an act  reap a habit  sow a habit  reap a character  sow a character  reap a destiny.
data.author: G. D. Boardman

data.quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it. ... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
data.author: Alex Haley

data.quote: A little neglect may breed great mischief. ... For want of a nail  the shoe was lost  for want of a shoe  the horse was lost  for want of a horse  the battle was lost  for want of the battle  the war was lost.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Inspiration does not come like a blot  nor is it kinetic energy striving  but it comes to us slowly and quietly all the time.
data.author: Brenda Euland

data.quote: There is time enough for everything in the course of the day if you do but one thing once  but there is not time enough in the year if you will do two things at a time.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: Incident piled on incident no more makes life than brick piled on brick makes a house.
data.author: Edith Ronald Mirrielees

data.quote: It's a long old road  but I know I'm gonna find the end.
data.author: Bessie Smith

data.quote: Think not because no man sees  such things will remain unseen.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Connections are made slowly  sometimes they grow underground.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: I never stop to plan. I take things step-by-step.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: There are very few human beings who receive the truth  complete and staggering  by instant illumination. Most of them acquire it fragment by fragment  on a small scale  by successive developments  cellularly  like a laborious mosaic.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: Connections are made slowly  sometimes they grow underground.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: Human successes  like human failures  are composed of one action at a time and achieved by one person at a time.
data.author: Patty H. Sampson

data.quote: The growth of understanding follows an ascending spiral rather than a straight line.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: I look at victory as milestones on a very long highway.
data.author: Joan Benoit Samuelson

data.quote: No first step can be really great  it must of necessity possess more of prophecy than of achievement  nevertheless it is by the first step that a man marks the value  not only of his cause  but of himself.
data.author: Katherine Cecil Thurston

data.quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: If  after all  men cannot always make history have a meaning  they can always act so that their own lives have one.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Every worthwhile accomplishment  big or little  has its stages of drudgery and triumph  a beginning  a struggle  and a victory.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The world is moved not only by the mighty shoves of the heroes  but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen  in small matters  as they are.
data.author: Gamaliel Bradford

data.quote: Backward  turn backward  O Time in your flight  Make me a child again just for tonight.
data.author: Elizabeth Akers Allen

data.quote: In time take time while time doth last  for time Is no time when time is past.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Time whereof the memory of man runneth not to the contrary.
data.author: Sir William Blackstone

data.quote: Time is money.
data.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Time was made for slaves.
data.author: John B. Buckstone

data.quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: Know the true value of time  snatch  seize  and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness  no laziness  no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: O temporal O mores! O what times! what morals!
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: See Time has touched me gently in his race  And left no odious furrows in my face.
data.author: George Grabbe

data.quote: Time and tide wait for no man.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Do not squander time for that is the stuff life is made of.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: A stitch in time saves nine.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Gather ye rose-buds while ye may  Old Time is still aflying  And this same flower that smiles today  Tomorrow will be dying.
data.author: Robert Herrick

data.quote: Enjoy the present day  trusting very little to the morrow.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: My time has not yet come.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Better late than never.
data.author: Livy

data.quote: The signs of the times.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: The bird of time has but a little way To flutter - and the bird is on the wing.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Time is a great legalizer  even in the field of morals.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: These are the times that try men's souls.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: Time is the wisest counselor.
data.author: Pericles

data.quote: Seize time by the forelock.
data.author: Pittacus of Mitylene

data.quote: A thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past  and as a watch in the night.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: We spend our years as a tale that is told.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: An age builds up cities: an hour destroys them.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: There's a time for all things.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The time is out of joint.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: O  call back yesterday  bid time return.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Make use of time  let not advantage slip.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A wonderful stream is the River Time  As it runs through the realms of Tears  With a faultless rhythm  and a musical rhyme  As it blends with the ocean of Years.
data.author: Benjamin F. Taylor

data.quote: Once in Persia reigned a king Who upon his signet ring Graved a maxim true and wise  Which if held before the eyes Gave him counsel at a glance Fit for every change and chance. Solemn words  and these are they: "Even this shall pass away."
data.author: Theodore Tilton

data.quote: Some hae meat  and canna eat  And some wad eat that want it  But we hae meat  and we can eat  And sae the Lord be thankit.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Here's a sigh to those who love me And a smile to those who hate  And whatever sky's above me  Here's a heart for every fate.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: A cup to the dead already  -  Hurrah for the next that dies.
data.author: Dowling Bartholomew

data.quote: Dowling Drink to me only with thine eyes  And I will pledge with mine  Or leave a kiss but in the cup  And I'll not look for wine.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: Here's to your good health  and your family's good health  and may you all live long and prosper.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: A glass is good  and a lass is good  And a pipe to smoke in cold weather  The world is good and the people are good  And we're all good fellows together.
data.author: John O'Keeffe

data.quote: May you live all the days of your life.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Here is a toast that I want to give To a fellow I'll never know  To the fellow who's going to take my place When it's time for me to go.
data.author: Louis E. Thayer

data.quote: Little tube of mighty pow'r  Charmer of an idle hour  Object of my warm desire.
data.author: Isaac Hawkins Browne

data.quote: A woman is only a woman  but a good cigar is a smoke.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: For thy sake  tobacco  I Would do anything but die.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: What this country needs is a good five-cent cigar.
data.author: Thomas R. Marshall

data.quote: A cigarette is the perfect type of a perfect pleasure. It is exquisite  and it leaves one unsatisfied. What more can you want?
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: We are here today and gone tomorrow.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone  He  who can call today his own: He who  secure within  can say  Tomorrow  do thy worst  for I have liv'd today.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Tomorrow life is too late: live today.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: Tolerance is the only real test of civilization.
data.author: Arthur Helps

data.quote: Toleration is the best religion.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: It is intolerance to speak of toleration. Away with the word from the dictionary!
data.author: Mirabeau

data.quote: Live and let live.
data.author: Scottish proverb

data.quote: There is a budding tomorrow in midnight.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Tomorrow! - Why  tomorrow I may be Myself with yesterday's sev'n thousand years.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Tomorrow never yet On any human being rose or set.
data.author: William Marsden

data.quote: Boast not thyself of tomorrow  for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Many a man's tongue shakes out his master's undoing.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The tongue can no man tame  it is an unruly evil.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: All travelling becomes dull in exact proportion to its rapidity.
data.author: John Rusk

data.quote: I dislike feeling at home when I am abroad.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Like all great travellers  I have seen more than I remember  and remember more than I have seen.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli
