data.quote: A man travels the world in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: In Paris they simply stared when I spoke to them in French  I never did succeed in making those idiots understand their own language.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Lovers of air travel find it exhilarating to hang poised between the illusion of immortality and the fact of death.
data.author: Alexander Chase

data.quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make  And better friends I'll not be knowing  Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take  No matter where it's going.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: One sees great things from the valley  only small things from the peak.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: The American arrives in Paris with a few French phrases he has culled from a conversational guide or picked up from a friend who owns a beret.
data.author: Fred Allen

data.quote: The crow  when travelling abroad  came back just as black.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The journey is the reward.
data.author: Tao saying

data.quote: The routines of tourism are even more monotonous than those of daily life.
data.author: Mason Cooley

data.quote: The time to enjoy a European trip is about three weeks after unpacking.
data.author: George Ade

data.quote: There is a ghost That eats handkerchiefs  It keeps you company On all your travels.
data.author: Christian Morgenstern

data.quote: I like terra firma - the more firma  the less terra.
data.author: George S. Kaufman

data.quote: When I was at home  I was in a better place  but travellers must be content.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I have travelled a good deal in Concord.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: A bred-in-the-bone Boston lady  when asked why she never travelled  said 'Why should I? I'm already there.'
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: The early North American Indian made a great mistake by not having an immigration bureau.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice  bigotry and narrow-mindedness.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Every perfect traveller always creates the country where he travels.
data.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

data.quote: No man should travel until he has learned the language of the country he visits  otherwise he voluntarily makes himself a great baby - so helpless and ridiculous.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: As the Spanish proverb says  'He who would bring home the wealth of the Indies  must carry the wealth of the Indies with him.' So it is with traveling. A man must carry knowledge with him if he would bring home knowledge.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: How much a dunce that has been sent to roam Excels a dunce that has been kept at home!
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: The traveller's-eye view of men and women is not satisfying. A man might spend his life in trains and restaurants and know nothing of humanity at the end. To know  one must be an actor as well as a spectator.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: My favourite thing is to go where I've never been.
data.author: Diane Arbus

data.quote: Usually speaking  the worst-bred person in company is a young traveller just returned from abroad.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: For my part  I travel not to go anywhere  but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: I met a lot of people in Europe. I even encountered myself.
data.author: James Baldwin

data.quote: Travel is ninety per cent anticipation and ten per cent recollection.
data.author: Edward Streeter

data.quote: If one had but a single glance to give the world  one should gaze on Istanbul.
data.author: Alphonse de Lamartine

data.quote: There is no unhappiness like the misery of sighting land again after a cheerful  careless voyage.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Before he sets out  the traveller must possess fixed interests and facilities  to be served by travel. If he drifted aimlessly from country to country he would not travel but only wander  ramble as a tramp. The traveller must be somebody and come from somewhere so his definite character and moral traditions may supply an organ and a point of comparison for his observations.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: When you travel  remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.
data.author: Clifton Fadiman

data.quote: Wherever I travel  I'm too late. The orgy has moved elsewhere.
data.author: Mordecai Richler

data.quote: (Airplanes) may kill you  but they ain't likely to hurt you.
data.author: Satchel Paige

data.quote: If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man  then wherever you go for the rest of your life  it stays with you  for Paris is a movable feast.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: Old men and far travellers may lie with authority.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Russia is the only country of the world you can be homesick for while you're still in it.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: Travel teaches toleration.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: I am fevered with the sunset  I am fretful with the bay  For the wander-thirst is on me And my soul is in Cathay.
data.author: Richard Hovey

data.quote: As the Spanish proverb says  "He who would bring home the wealth of the Indies must carry the wealth of the Indies with him." So it is in traveling: a man must carry knowledge with him  if he would bring home knowledge.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Down to Gehenna or up to the throne  He travels the fastest who travels alone.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: The more I see of other countries the more I love my own.
data.author: Mme. De Stael

data.quote: The little Road says  Go  The little House says  Stay  And oh  it's bonny here at home  But I must go away.
data.author: Josephine P. Peabody

data.quote: Good company in a journey makes the way to seem the shorter.
data.author: Izaak Walton

data.quote: Treachery  though at first very cautious  in the end betrays itself.
data.author: Livy

data.quote: Et tu Brute! (You too  Brutus!)
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A tree depicts divinest plan  But God himself lives in a man.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: This is the forest primeval.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Tall oaks from little acorns grow.
data.author: David Everett

data.quote: The tree of knowledge of good and evil.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Poems are made by fools like me  But only God can make a tree.
data.author: Joyce Kilmer

data.quote: The tree is known by his fruit.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Woodman  spare that tree! Touch not a single bough! In youth it sheltered me  And I'll protect it now.
data.author: George P. Morris

data.quote: Tis a lesson you should heed  Try  try  try again If at first you don't succeed  Try  try  try again.
data.author: W. E. Hickson

data.quote: There are no crown-bearers in heaven who were not cross-bearers here below.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Help to make earth happy  like the heaven above.
data.author: Julia F. Carney

data.quote: For precept must be upon precept  precept upon precept  line upon line  line upon line  here a little  and there a little.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A little one shall become a thousand  and a small one a strong nation.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Events of great consequence often spring from trifling circumstances.
data.author: Livy

data.quote: Trifles make perfection - and perfection is no trifle.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: For the maintenance of peace  nations should avoid the pin-pricks which forerun cannon-shots.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: Never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
data.author: American Proverb

data.quote: He that seeks trouble always finds it.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Troubles  like babies  grow larger by nursing.
data.author: Lady Holland

data.quote: Man is born unto trouble  as the sparks fly upward.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: To take arms against a sea of troubles.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Though life is made up of mere bubbles  'Tis better than many aver  For while we've a whole lot of troubles  The most of them never occur.
data.author: Nixon Waterman

data.quote: True love is like ghosts  which everybody talks about and few have seen.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: True love is eternal  infinite  and always like itself. It is equal and pure  without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Generally  by the time you are Real  most of your hair has been loved off  and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all  because once you are Real you can't be ugly  except to people who don't understand.
data.author: Margery Williams

data.quote: All kings  and all their favourites  All glory of honours  beauties  wits  The sun itself  which makes time  as they pass  Is elder by a year now than it was When thou and I first one another saw. All other things to their destruction draw  Only our love hath no decay  This no to-morrow hath  nor yesterday  Running it never runs from us away  But truly keeps his first  last  everlasting day.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Love looks not with the eyes  but with the mind  And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally.
data.author: W. C. Fields

data.quote: It gives me great strength to know that half the people I meet are below average.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I was once thrown out of a mental hospital for depressing other patients.
data.author: Oscar Levant

data.quote: We'd all like a reputation for generosity  and we'd all like to buy it cheap.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: I may have faults  but being wrong ain't one of them.
data.author: Jimmy Hoffa

data.quote: After twelve years of therapy my psychiatrist said something that brought tears to my eyes. He said  "No bablo ingles."
data.author: Ronnie Shakes

data.quote: I'm not at all stuck up . . . although  judging from those around me  I have every right to be.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Lead me not into temptation  I can find the way myself.
data.author: Rita Mae Brown

data.quote: I've got nothing against girls in tight sweaters - darn it!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Let's just say  he has too many pigeons on his antenna.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have my standards. They may be low  but I have them.
data.author: Bette Midler

data.quote: She's not moody. She's just known for her versatility of emotions.
data.author: Louise Lotz

data.quote: Yesterday was the first day of the rest of your life . . . and you messed it up again.
data.author: Patrick Murray

data.quote: Show me someone who never gossips  and I'll show you someone who isn't interested in people.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: I always read the last page of a book first  so that if I die before I finish I'll know how it turned out.
data.author: Nora Ephron

data.quote: Well-adjusted means you can make the same mistakes over and over again  and keep smiling.
data.author: George Bergman

data.quote: When someone sings his own praises  he always gets the tune too high.
data.author: Mary Waldrip

data.quote: Everybody hates me because I'm so universally liked.
data.author: Peter de Vries

data.quote: I have too much respect for the truth to drag it out on every trifling occasion.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you  snore and you sleep alone.
data.author: Katharine Whitehorn

data.quote: How beautiful is victory  but how dear!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Victories that are cheap are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: To the victors belong the spoils.
data.author: Andrew Jackson

data.quote: Who overcomes By force  hath overcome but half his foe.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.
data.author: Michel Montaigne

data.quote: We have met the enemy and they are ours.
data.author: Oliver Hazard Perry

data.quote: It is better to be violent  if there is violence in our hearts  than to put on the cloak of non-violence to cover impotence.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Keep violence in the mind Where it belongs.
data.author: Brian Aldiss

data.quote: Violence is the quest for identity. When identity disappears with technological innovation  violence is the natural recourse.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: Violence is essentially wordless  and it can begin only where thought and rational communication have broken down.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: You know what I think about violence. For me it is profoundly moral -more moral than compromises and transactions.
data.author: Benito Mussolini

data.quote: Violence is just  where kindness is vain.
data.author: Corneille

data.quote: It is unfair to blame man too fiercely for being pugnacious  he learned the habit from Nature.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: Is some cases non-violence requires more militancy than violence.
data.author: Cesar Chavez

data.quote: We are all shot through with enough motives to make a massacre  any day of the week that we want to give them their head.
data.author: Jacob Bronowski

data.quote: In a war of ideas it is people who get killed.
data.author: Stanislaw J. Lee

data.quote: The private terror of the liberal spirit is invariably suicide  not murder.
data.author: Norman Mailer

data.quote: Violence is  essentially  a confession of ultimate inarticulateness.
data.author: Time Magazine

data.quote: Non-violence is a powerful and just weapon. It is a weapon unique in history  which cuts without wounding and enobles the man who wields it. It is a sword that heals.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Today violence is the rhetoric of the period.
data.author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: A tragic situation exists precisely when virtue does not triumph but when it is still felt that man is nobler than the forces which destroy him.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: Humility is a virtue  and it is a virtue innate in guests.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: The sun  though it passes through dirty places  yet remains as pure as before.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: There are few virtues which the Poles do not possess and there are few errors they have ever avoided.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Virtue has its own reward  but no sale at the box office.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: When virtue has slept  she will get up more refreshed.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Purity is obscurity.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: I know myself too well to believe in pure virtue.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: There are few chaste women who are not tired of their trade.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Ascetic: one who makes a necessity of virtue.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: A virtue to be serviceable must  like gold  be alloyed with some commoner but more durable metal.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: The Saints are the Sinners who keep on trying.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: No doubt alcohol  tobacco  and so forth  are things that a saint must avoid  but sainthood is also a thing that human beings must avoid.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: If a man has no vices  he's in great danger of making vices about his virtues  and there's a spectacle.
data.author: Thornton Wilder

data.quote: When men grow virtuous in their old age  they only make a sacrifice to God of the devil's leavings.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: If virtue were its own reward  it would no longer be a human quality  but supernatural.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Let him who believes in immortality enjoy his happiness in silence without giving himself airs about it.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: One's outlook is a part of his virtue.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: Virtue is like a rich stone  best plain set.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: Recommend to your children virtue  that alone can make them happy  not gold.
data.author: Beethoven

data.quote: Honor is the reward of virtue.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: I believe that Virtue shows quite as well in rags and patches as she does in purple and fine linen.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: There are those who have nothing chaste but their ears  and nothing virtuous but their tongues.
data.author: De Finod

data.quote: The only reward of virtue is virtue.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Most men admire Virtue  who follow not her lore.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Our virtues are most frequently but vices disguised.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Virtue is an angel  but she is a blind one  and must ask of Knowledge to show her the pathway that leads to her goal.
data.author: Horace Mann

data.quote: I prefer an accommodation vice to an obstinate virtue.
data.author: Moliere

data.quote: Virtue is health  vice is sickness.
data.author: Petrarch

data.quote: Virtue consists  not in abstaining from vice  but in not desiring it.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Virtue often trips and falls on the sharp-edged rock of poverty.
data.author: Eugene Sue

data.quote: Abou Ben Adhem (may his tribe increase!) Awoke one night from a deep dream of peace  And saw  within the moonlight in his room  Making it rich  and like a lily in bloom  An angel  writing in a book of gold  Exceeding peace had made Ben Adhem bold  And to the presence in the room he said -  "What writest thou?" The Vision raised its head  And  with a look made all of sweet accord  Answered  "The names of those who love the Lord."
data.author: Leigh Hunt

data.quote: Where there is no vision  the people perish.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: And it shall come to pass afterward  that I will pour out my Spirit upon all flesh  and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy  your old men shall dream dreams  your young men shall see visions.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: My thoughts by night are often filled With visions false as fair: For in the past alone  I build My castles in the air.
data.author: Thomas Love Peacock

data.quote: Before you begin a thing remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. ... You can only see one thing clearly  and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: Man can only receive what he sees himself receiving.
data.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

data.quote: A person can grow only as much as his horizon allows.
data.author: John Powell

data.quote: All prosperity begins in the mind and is dependent only upon the full use of our creative imagination.
data.author: Ruth Ross

data.quote: If we have not achieved our early dreams  we must either find new ones or see what we can salvage from the old. If we have accomplished what we set out to do in our youth  we need not weep like Alexander the Great that we have no more worlds to conquer.
data.author: Rosalynn Carter

data.quote: What man can imagine he may one day achieve.
data.author: Nancy Hale

data.quote: Envisioning the end is enough to put the means in motion.
data.author: Dorothea Brande

data.quote: Our visions begin with our desires.
data.author: Audre Lorde

data.quote: It is in our idleness  in our dreams  that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: One must desire something to be alive: perhaps absolute satisfaction is only another name for Death.
data.author: Margaret Deland

data.quote: The truth isn't always beauty  but the hunger for it is.
data.author: Nadine Gordimer

data.quote: When your dreams tire  they go underground and out of kindness that's where they stay.
data.author: Libby Houston

data.quote: Nothing happens unless first a dream.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: The very least you can do in your life is to figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it  under its roof.
data.author: Barbara Kingsolver

data.quote: The history of all times  and of today especially  teaches that... women will be forgotten if they forget to think about themselves.
data.author: Louise Otto

data.quote: Instead of thinking about where you are  think about where you want to be. It takes twenty years of hard work to become an overnight success.
data.author: Diana Rankin

data.quote: To the lack of incentive to effort  which is the awful shadow under which we live  may be traced the wreck and ruin of scores of colored youth.
data.author: Mary Church Terrell

data.quote: The moment of enlightenment is when a person's dreams of possibilities become images of probabilities.
data.author: Vic Braden

data.quote: Reach high  for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep  for every dream precedes the goal.
data.author: Pamela Vaull Starr

data.quote: When we can't dream any longer  we die.
data.author: Emma Goldman

data.quote: Hold fast to dreams  for if dreams die  life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
data.author: Langston Hughes

data.quote: I think  at a child's birth  if a mother could ask a fairy godmother to endow it with the most useful gift  that gift should be curiosity.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: You know  my children  that humanity advances only by forming itself an ideal and endeavoring to realize it. Every passion has its ideal  which is modified by that of the whole.
data.author: Jenny R d'Hericourt

data.quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good  and we must hunger for them.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The best antidote I have found is to yearn for something. As long as you yearn  you can't congeal: there is a forward motion to yearning.
data.author: Gail Godwin

data.quote: Every woman dreams of her own political career and her own place in life.
data.author: Raisa M. Gorbachev

data.quote: Dream lofty dreams  and as you dream  so shall you become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall at last unveil.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Imagination is the highest kite that can fly.
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: Who would ever give up the reality of dreams for relative knowledge?
data.author: Alice James

data.quote: Dreams are the sources of action  the meeting and the end  a resting place among the flight of things.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: Within your heart  keep one still  secret spot where dreams may go.
data.author: Louise Driscoll

data.quote: I've dreamt in my life dreams that have stayed with me ever after  and changed my ideas: they've gone through and through me  like wine through water  and altered the color of my mind.
data.author: Emily Bronte

data.quote: It may be that those who do most  dream most.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: I've dreamt in my life dreams that have stayed with me ever after  and changed my ideas: they've gone through and through me  like wine through water  and altered the color of my mind.
data.author: Emily Bronte

data.quote: It's our dreams that keep us going  that separate us from the beasts. I wouldn't even want to live if I thought it was all just eating and sleeping and taking off my clothes.
data.author: Mary Chase

data.quote: A couple of times a day I sit quietly and visualize my body fighting the AIDS virus. It's the same as me sitting and seeing myself hit the perfect serve. I did that often when I was an athlete.
data.author: Arthur Ashe

data.quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Imagination has always had powers of resurrection that no science can match.
data.author: Ingrid Bengis

data.quote: The artist doesn't see things as they are  but as he is.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Make-believe colors the past with innocent distortion  and it swirls ahead of us in a thousand ways-in science  in politics  in every bold intention. It is part of our collective lives  entwining our past and our future ... a particularly rewarding aspect of life itself.
data.author: Shirley Temple Black

data.quote: We are governed not by armies  but by ideas.
data.author: Mona Caird

data.quote: One of your most powerful inner resources is your own creativity. Be willing to try on something new and play the game full-out.
data.author: Marcia Wieder

data.quote: No vision and you perish  No ideal  and you're lost  Your heart must ever cherish Some faith at any cost. Some hope  some dream to cling to  Some rainbow in the sky  Some melody to sing to  Some service that is high.
data.author: Harriet Du Autermont
